interfaces.name: Picimo.App
interfaces.description:
Der Anfang von allem. Das ist der __Main Controller__ deiner App.
Der einfachste Weg eine App Instanz zu erzeugen ist mittels

`let app = new Picimo.App(/* options */);`

Das `<canvas>` Element wird automatisch erzeugt und unterhalb von *document.body* in das DOM eingefügt.
Alternativ ist die Angabe des Container Elements mittels **appendTo** möglich.
Will man stattdessen ein vorhandenes `<canvas>` nutzen, oder einfach selbst erzeugen, übergibt man dieses
mit der Option **canvas**, alternativ auch als ersten Parameter bei der Erzeugung der App Instanz:

`let app = new Picimo.App(myCanvas/* , options */);`

Egal, ob man das Canvas Element selbst erzeugt oder übergibt, es wird in jedem Falle die _CSS class_ __.picimo__
an das Element gehängt.

Die wohl wichtigste Property einer App ist die *root* scene `app.scene`

Die App bietet auch Zugriff auf das *Sprite, Texture* und *Shader* Management.

When set to `false` the node will not be displayed. The *frame*, *renderFrame* and *frameEnd* events will not be called.
BUT `init` and `initGl` will be called. If you don't want to initialize the node set the *ready* attribute to `false`.

attributes.description:
You should specify either of *displaySize* or *displayPosition*.
If both properties are *not* specified the *displaySize* will be set to `'contain'`.
See [Picimo.sg.Picture.DisplaySize](#) for more information.

dictionaries.name: Picimo.sg.Picture.DisplayPosition
dictionaries.description:
The display position specifies how the picture is positioned *in relationship to the scene dimension*.

![The Display Position](/assets/images/doc/displayPosition.png)
![The Display Position Zoom](/assets/images/doc/displayPosition zoom.png)

attributes.name: top
attributes.description:
Set the top edge of the image under the top edge of the parent scene.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of scene height_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: left
attributes.description:
Set the left edge of the image right to the left edge of the parent scene.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of scene width_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: bottom
attributes.description:
Set the bottom edge of the image above the bottom edge of the parent scene.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of scene height_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: right
attributes.description:
Set the right edge of the image left to the right edge of the parent scene.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of scene width_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: width
attributes.description:
Set the width of the image.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of image width_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: height
attributes.description:
Set the height of the image.

The unit is either of **px** (if value is a *number*) or of **percantage _of image height_** (if value is a *string* — eg. `'50%'`)

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description:
Set the zoom factor.

Default is `1.0` (no zoom). If set to `2.0` the size of the image will be _doubled_.

enums.name: Picimo.sg.Picture.DisplaySize
enums.description_post:
![The Display Size Property](/assets/images/doc/displaySize.png)

The display size specifies the size of the picture.

- **contain** will always show the whole image but may not fill up the whole screen area.
- **cover** will always fill the whole screen area, but the image may be cropped.

Both strategies will preserve the image size ratio.
